issue.title: Require astroid 2.5.7

repository.name: pylint
repository.description: It's not just a linter that annoys you!

issue.body:
## Description

Upgrade astroid so we get the latest fixes.

## Related Issue

https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/pull/4471
https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/pull/4473
https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/pull/4428
https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/pull/4348

issue.title: pin astroid version?

repository.name: pylint
repository.description: It's not just a linter that annoys you!

issue.body:
Hi there. Would it be possible to pin the astroid version? It looks like in `astroid==2.5.7`, the inference was improved and started to notify errors that were false negatives before (which is a good thing).

But this makes CI fail in a surprising way. If the new release came with `pylint`, it'd have been easier to fix the errors. ðŸ™‚

body: I think this can be closed as well now that https://github.com/PyCQA/astroid/pull/1009 is merged.
Actually, let me release 2.5.8 and change the version used in pylint :)
@Pierre-Sassoulas am I correct in assuming that now that this issue is fixed, you'll be able to release pylint 2.9.0 reasonably soon?

labels.name: Maintenance
labels.description: Discussion or action around maintaining pylint or the dev workflow

repository.name: pylint
repository.description: It's not just a linter that annoys you!

body:
You can check what need to be done here: https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/milestone/25

Right now there is two small documentation tasks, one big checker and one checker that we would remove if @yushao2 is not available and the three other tasks are done.
